message: I'm remote
Me! I'm about to start beating up on some UN data from Azure etc.

Stef: I like your tracker app idea, something I've missed when attending events. Thought about something similar using geolocation & hash tags to pool together people dynamically, more for a generated reference list post event.
*Raises hand*. Didn't hear about the event until this morning, clearly a cave dweller. Getting some ideas together now.
Not sure how accurate the geolocation is though, would be more accurate if they are using the conference wifi I imagine.
From my experience at SXSW you can't rely on a mobile connection - it gets clogged up, and when you're in the building there's no geolocation available... but for other stuff sure!
Glad you like the idea!
Could work well at festivals?
Yeah, pretty much the same story at most conferences come to think of it. Should be easy to organise based on tags, is there a service out there that already does that?
Say that just populates a twitter list with people using a certain tag?
Geoharvesting would be more interesting (if accurate) for events or perhaps festivals that don't have an assigned hash tag already.
I too am remote...
Perhaps the question should have been who's _not_ remote! Nice to meet you all.
Hello everyone. I'm at the guardian and want to use the lanyrd api. Anybody got any ideas or want some help?
awesome, glad to hear it
at the moment the API only has the interactive sessions
do you think there's much demand for film and music as well?
I could try and load those in too
We are all remote, hi from TLV
@simonw if I were you i'd take sleep over extensions to the API!
Re: "can't rely on a mobile connection - it gets clogged up" A common problem. As ppl depend so much on their mobiles is there a solution to this - a local concentrator or somesuch?
I am remote. Hi from Horsham.
@dougm what I'm doing is using jquery mobile and backbone.js to do a local data store so you don't need a mobile connection after the first hit on an api url
Doug - I've just moved from a job in Horsham to.. er... New York.
My time is up :-(  Thanks for the company. Result is up at http://projects.neontribe.co.uk/gsxsw/
hi jaggeree
how's the hacking?
not yet, will have a play very soon... will send you link to our secret API soon (it's a tad raw)
ahh just missed you Rupert, love the thing...
Hi Simon
Not bad, occasionally slowed by toddler and infant stealing focus (literally)
how's you and Nat (and the hacking)
good - bit sleep deprived
it's 8:30am here
need more crowdsourcing help! http://sxsw-preview-api.lanyrd.net/crowdsource/2011/sxsw/
have you poked around our API yet?
I remember those odd San Fran/London days
@jaggeree how do?
haha - you've guessed what I'm up to this weekend then. Digital twiddling of thumbs...
it's due tomorrow!
hey Stef, how's the waiting period before new arrival?
Morning all... any news @stef and anyone know how we submit a remotely made hack
Haz made a thing for #gSxSW need your voices please... http://fdtdsxsw.appspot.com/ all will be revealed later
ha ha, glad you're both busy to make the waiting not seem so bad...
looking forward to seeing what you made
Aside from the fact that the new JQuery mobile completely breaks my app (and all of my old ones) at a fundamental level it's looking good...
@jaggeree nothing to report yet! Emily is busy writing her thesis.... but I have a lovely little app here using Lanyrd.
oh no, haven't played with the latest JQuery Mobile... hmmmm, not so good
